page.title: 01Heather And District
page.content: The area contains two small Leicestershire villages - Heather and Swepstone. The relatively flat environment is characterised by a mixture of open-cast mining, arable farming or stock-rearing, and small enterprises such as the brick and chemical works, as well as providing a residential area for many that commute to work. The City of Leicester is about 15 miles away, whilst Ashby and Coalville are within a 5-mile radius. Figures from the latest Census are: Parish of Heather - Population 837. Employed in Mining, 40; Agriculture 0. Parish of Swepstone - Population 522. Employed in Mining, 30; Agriculture 30. Unemployment figures for North West Leicestershire, which includes this area, in March 1985 were 3,441. In percentage terms, this is 9.6%.
